title: Insurers, Some States Extend Deadlines For Health Coverage
teaser: Health insurers say they will give people more time to pay their premiums for health plans, and still have coverage start January 1st.
contentencoded:
Health insurers say they will give people more time to pay their premiums for health plans, and still have coverage start January 1st.

A number of states have also extended their deadlines for people to enroll and choose a plan that will kick in on the first of the year, amid a flurry of last-minute sign-ups.

Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson talks to Julie RovnerÂ of Kaiser Health News about the deadline extensions and how this second open enrollment period for the Affordable Care Act is going so far.

Guest

  • Julie Rovner, senior correspondent for Kaiser Health News. She tweets @jrovner.
